intro: Hieracium pelliceps, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium pelliceps is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
